meanings.definition: Something that makes it difficult to do or complete something
meanings.sent1: Carrying heavy bags was an impediment to her reaching the top of the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was a major impediment to getting to work on time.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door seemed to be an impediment to his grand entrance.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of public speaking acted as an impediment to her career advancement.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was an impediment to the driver's visibility on the road.

meanings.definition: A physical defect that makes it difficult to speak or move normally
meanings.sent1: His stutter was an impediment to clear communication with others.
meanings.sent2: The injury to his leg was an impediment to his ability to walk without assistance.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's mimicking skills were an impediment to serious conversations in the house.
meanings.sent4: The heavy chains around his ankles were an impediment to his escape from captivity.
meanings.sent5: The thick mud on the path was an impediment to the hiker's progress.
